name: NPR
text:
The established indie singer and songwriter Mark Kozelek, who frequently performs as Sun Kil Moon, has been accused of sexual misconduct by 3 women in a report published by Pitchfork.
https://t.co/VCjYblpZho

name: NPR
text: Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp has withdrawn a lawsuit he filed against Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms and the City Council over a mask requirement and other COVID-19-related safeguards.  https://t.co/hDN1jiC0OD

name: NPR
text:
"I heard it today that she doesn't meet the requirements. I have no idea if that's right," President Trump said of Sen. Kamala Harris, the presumptive Democratic vice-presidential nominee, who was born in Oakland, Calif.
https://t.co/VsoxJGUjsT

name: NPR
text:
Sue Gordon was in line to be acting Director of National Intelligence after Dan Coats quit last year. President Trump thought otherwise. 

Now, she recounts her time in his administration.
https://t.co/b0z6wqxpLI

name: NPR
text:
The director of the CDC is warning of the dual threat of the coronavirus and the flu this fall, urging Americans to wear a mask, social distance and get the flu vaccine.
https://t.co/R12Wv8DvHw

name: NPR
text:
The NCAA's president says there will be no championships this fall, with the possible exception of football, because not enough schools are participating due to cancellations and season postponements.
https://t.co/LUbu9Jksgp

name: NPR
text:
If you want to socialize with family or friends, can testing in advance keep everyone safe?  

We asked experts how diagnostic tests work and how to interpret the results. https://t.co/owkbU9gQ4I

name: NPR
text:
Giving kids deworming pills boosted their household income as adults by 13%, a new study finds. 

But there are significant caveats. For one, income boost was limited to men â€” even though women saw the biggest education gains.
https://t.co/R4m3jHJJtu
